papers.title: Status Report of Vacuum System of Esrf
authors: The presentation will go first briefly through the design
assembly and installation of the new EBS storage ring at ESRF
performances and improvements of the vacuum system.

papers.title: Status and Experiences of Vacuum System in the SuperKEKB Main Ring
authors: Since the start of SuperKEKB operation in 2016
the stored beam currents have gradually increased in the main ring. In the commissioning of 2022 spring

the maximum beam currents were ~1460 mA in the low energy ring for positron (LER) and ~1145 mA in the high energy ring for electron (HER). The beam doses up to now have been ~ 7312 Ah in LER and ~6199 Ah in HER
and the vacuum scrubbing of the beam pipes is proceeding well. On the other hand
problems such as abnormal pressure rises
collimator damages and so on have occurred. Here
we mainly report on the experiences and status in the vacuum system after the commissioning in the spring of 2019 named Phase-3

papers.title: Vacuum System of the FCC-ee
authors: The analysis and design of the vacuum system for the FCC-ee e- and e+ rings is outlined. The main vacuum-relevant parameters are recalled
with particular emphasis on the copious emission of synchrotron radiation (SR) along the rings
and its direct and indirect effects on vac-uum
generation of photoelectrons. A status report of the present design
and prototyping phase of several key vacuum components is also given.
